question: You've received a friend request from someone you don't know. do you accept them?
options: No, you decline the request and block them. If it's made you feel uncomfortable or worried you tell a parent/guardian/teacher
Yes, and then send them a message asking who they are
You ask your friends to find out if anyone knows who the person is and only accept if someone else knows them
answer: No, you decline the request and block them. If it's made you feel uncomfortable or worried you tell a parent/guardian/teacher

question: You want to post a video to TikTok, but you were wearing your school uniform in the video. Does it matter?
options: No it doesn't matter, everyone knows which school you go to anyway
It would be better without the uniform but you can't be bothered to refilm it
Yes, it matters because your uniform has the school name on it, which is personal info and it can give away your location
answer: Yes, it matters because your uniform has the school name on it, which is personal info and it can give away your location

question: Which of these will always show you pictures of cars?
options: Cars
"Cars"
asdCars
answer: "Cars"

question: Your friend always 'checks in' to whatever location you are at, tagging you in the post too. Should you ask her to stop tagging you?
options: Yes, ask your friend not to check in because you don't want to share your location
No, just have a competition to see who can tag who quickest next time!
You'd like to, but you know they will say you are being silly by not wanting them to tag you
answer: Yes, ask your friend not to check in because you don't want to share your location

question: You get an email from the app you use all the time asking for your password to fix a problem with your account. What do you do?
options: Reply straight away with your password – you don't want to risk losing access
Don’t click on any links, but go to the app itself and check for any genuine messages
Reply asking for confirmation that the email is genuine and not a scam before sending your password
answer: Don’t click on any links, but go to the app itself and check for any genuine messages

question: In a game chat someone you don't know sends you a link. What do you do?
options: Don't click on any links. You can report the message or just delete straight away
The name looks familiar, so you click the link to see if it is anything interesting
Forward it to your friend to see what they think
answer: Don't click on any links. You can report the message or just delete straight away

question: Someone you know has sent you a message saying horrible things about another person. What should you do?
options: Agree with them, you don’t really like the other person anyway
Don't reply to the message, but take a screenshot and show it to an adult you trust
Ignore it and delete the message, you don't want to get involved
answer: Don't reply to the message, but take a screenshot and show it to an adult you trust

question: You find out someone has shared an embarrassing photo of you, what should you do?
options: Just ignore it and hope that it'll be a photo of someone else they find funny tomorrow
Message them and call them names to get back at them
You know it’ll be embarrassing, but it is best to tell an adult you trust (a parent, or teacher) what has happened so they can help
answer: You know it’ll be embarrassing, but it is best to tell an adult you trust (a parent, or teacher) what has happened so they can help

question: You’ve been chatting to another player on an online game for a few weeks and they’ve suggested meeting up at the weekend. What do you say?
options: This feels a bit weird, so tell an adult you trust (or a Childline counsellor)
Say yes as long as you can meet in a busy place
Take your best mate along with you, you’ll be fine if there are two of you
answer: This feels a bit weird, so tell an adult you trust (or a Childline counsellor)

question: How do you find out if a new game you want to play is suitable for your age?
options: Look it up on the app store or game developer site and see what age rating it has
Ask your mates if they are playing it. If they are you can get it too
You just play the games you like, so don’t bother checking what the age rating is
answer: Look it up on the app store or game developer site and see what age rating it has

question: You are struggling to pass a level on a game. A friend says that they can pass the level for you if you give them your password to log in. Should you do this?
options: If it gets you to the next level you’d try anything!
Say yes, but make them promise to forget your password straight away
Say thanks but no thanks because you don’t share passwords (or other personal info). But ask for some tips about the game instead
answer: Say thanks but no thanks because you don’t share passwords (or other personal info). But ask for some tips about the game instead

question: Which of the following are good practices for creating a strong password? (Select all that apply)
options: Use a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols
Use your pet’s name or birthday
Avoid using short passwords
Reuse the same password for multiple sites
Avoid using common words and phrases
answer: Use a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols
Avoid using short passwords
Avoid using common words and phrases

question: How can you make sure the websites you visit are safe? (Select all that apply)
options: Look for 'https://' at the beginning of the web address
Check if the site has a padlock symbol in the address bar
Ask a parent or trusted adult before using a new website
Click on pop-ups offering free prizes to test the website
Enter your personal information to see if the website asks for too much
answer: Look for 'https://' at the beginning of the web address
Check if the site has a padlock symbol in the address bar
Ask a parent or trusted adult before using a new website

question: What should you do if you accidentally land on an inappropriate or unsafe website? (Select all that apply)
options: Close the website immediately
Tell a trusted adult what happened
Use a safe search filter to help avoid bad websites in the future
Stay on the site and see what’s on it
Share the website link with friends to warn them
answer: Close the website immediately
Tell a trusted adult what happened
Use a safe search filter to help avoid bad websites in the future

question: What should you do if you accidentally land on an inappropriate or unsafe website? (Select all that apply)
options: Close the website immediately
Tell a trusted adult what happened
Use a safe search filter to help avoid bad websites in the future
Stay on the site and see what’s on it
Share the website link with friends to warn them
answer: Close the website immediately
Tell a trusted adult what happened
Use a safe search filter to help avoid bad websites in the future

question: Which of the following are safe practices when sharing information online? (Select all answers):
options: Only share information from trusted and verified sources
Double-check the information before sharing, even if it’s from a friend
Share personal information like your address or passwords with people you trust
Think about how the information might affect others before sharing
Post anything you see online if it seems interesting or funny
answer: Only share information from trusted and verified sources
Double-check the information before sharing, even if it’s from a friend
Think about how the information might affect others before sharing

question: What are good ways to stay safe when using a search engine? (Select all that apply)
options: Use kid-friendly search engines like Swiggle or Google SafeSearch
Check the source of the website before trusting what it says
Avoid clicking on sponsored ads at the top of the search results
Click on the first link that comes up, no matter what
Type in anything and see what comes up
answer: Use kid-friendly search engines like Swiggle or Google SafeSearch
Check the source of the website before trusting what it says
Avoid clicking on sponsored ads at the top of the search results
